Exaggerate: The claim may be considered as an exaggeration since it states that the New York bike path assault was the ninth vehicle assault used by ISIS, without providing sufficient evidence or a comprehensive list of previous attacks.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only provides a limited list of attacks in 2017 and does not include previous attacks such as the one in Nice, France, which was previously linked to ISIS.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the vehicle assaults mentioned in the claim, as some of them were not claimed by ISIS or had unclear motivations.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all the listed vehicle assaults were carried out by ISIS, based on either their claim of responsibility or the perpetrator claiming to act in the name of ISIS. This assumption may not always be accurate or fully supported.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not including all relevant attacks, such as the one in Nice, and by not providing a comprehensive analysis of the motives and affiliations of the perpetrators.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the New York bike path assault was the ninth vehicle assault used by ISIS, as it fails to provide a complete and accurate list of previous attacks.
